meanings.sent1: She had mickles of toys in her room.
meanings.sent2: The farmer harvested mickles of corn from his fields.
meanings.sent3: The birthday party had mickles of balloons floating around.
meanings.sent4: The treasure chest was overflowing with mickles of gold coins.
meanings.sent5: The library had mickles of books on its shelves.

meanings.definition: To gather or collect in large amounts.
meanings.sent1: The children mickles seashells along the shore.
meanings.sent2: She mickles berries from the bushes in the forest.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel mickles nuts for the winter in its burrow.
meanings.sent4: He mickles memories of his childhood in a scrapbook.
meanings.sent5: The ants mickles food for their colony in an organized manner.
